Serialized Form

  • Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.dao.aws.pojo

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.dao.aws.pojo.InputToCryptoACLambda extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • fileContent

          java.lang.String fileContent
          The (encrypted) content of the file. As of now, we sent the content by reading all bytes and encoding them in base64

        • fileName

          java.lang.String fileName
          The ID of the file that will be uploaded in S3

        • fileTupleIsSignerAUser

          boolean fileTupleIsSignerAUser
          This variable tells whether the signer is a user (true) or a role (false)

        • fileTupleSignature

          java.lang.String fileTupleSignature
          The signature of the file tuple encoded in base64

        • fileTupleSigner

          java.lang.String fileTupleSigner
          The ID of the signer of the file tuple. He may be either a user or a role

        • fileVersionNumber

          int fileVersionNumber
          The file version number (1 is the file is new, otherwise the current one)

        • operationNumber

          int operationNumber
          Which operation does the user want to perform? 0. add file 1. write file 2. read file (does not go through lambda but directly interact with S3) 3. add user (does not go through lambda but directly interact with RDS)

        • permissionTupleEncryptedSymmetricKey

          java.lang.String permissionTupleEncryptedSymmetricKey
          The encrypted symmetric key that was used to encrypt the file

        • permissionTupleRole

          java.lang.String permissionTupleRole
          The role related to the permission tuple. Even though there is the possibility to set it, for the moment the value will be ignored by the Lambda and replaced with the admin's one

        • permissionTupleSignature

          java.lang.String permissionTupleSignature
          The signature of the permission tuple encoded in base64. This only in the case that the operation is an "add new file"

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.dao.aws.pojo.OutputFromCryptoACLambda extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • moreDetailedError

          java.lang.String moreDetailedError
          In case it is needed, this is a string were to place a more detailed error coming from the Lambda

        • returningCode

          OperationOutcomeCode returningCode
          The code returned by the Lambda function

  • Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements.Role extends CryptoACActiveElement implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • roleVersionNumber

          int roleVersionNumber
          The version number (has to be greater than 1)

  • Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.tuple

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.tuple.FileTuple extends CryptoACTuple implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • associatedFilePath

          java.lang.String associatedFilePath
          The path (in the current file system) related to the associated object. Remember that the associated object for file tuples is a file

        • isSignerAUser

          boolean isSignerAUser
          given that a FileTuple can be signed by both users and roles, it is important to have a variable that holds this information, so to properly check the signature afterward

        • symmetricKeyVersionNumber

          int symmetricKeyVersionNumber
          The version number of the symmetric key. (has to be greater than 1) This points to the symmetric key that must be used to DECRYPT the file

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.tuple.PermissionTuple extends CryptoACTuple implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • associatedFile

          java.lang.String associatedFile
          The ID of the associated file

        • associatedPermission

          Permission associatedPermission
          The associated permission

        • encryptedSymmetricFileKey

          byte[] encryptedSymmetricFileKey
          encrypted symmetric key

        • pkiKeysVersionNumber

          int pkiKeysVersionNumber
          The version number of the PKI keys of the role (has to be greater than 1).

        • symmetricKeyVersionNumber

          int symmetricKeyVersionNumber
          The version number of the file (has to be greater than 1). This is to be able to distinguish between the key to user to DECRYPT the file (smaller number) and the key to use to ENCRYPT the file (bigger number)

  • Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.exceptions

    • Class eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.exceptions.DAOException extends java.lang.Exception implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • errorCode

          OperationOutcomeCode errorCode
          The error code associated with the original exception
